markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Full Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bulwark" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=202" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 30 gp

**AC Bonus** +6

**Dex Cap** +0

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 18

**Bulk** 4

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of [padded armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3) and a pair of [gauntlets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=4).

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Blast Suit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1601), [Containment Contraption](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1594), [Demon Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=150), [Dragonplate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=151), [Forgotten Shell](/Equipment.aspx?ID=892), [Glorious Plate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=520), [Plate Armor of the Deep](/Equipment.aspx?ID=157), [Victory Plate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=752)
name: Full Plate
